column4: Canada could scrap C$5 billion contract for Sikorsky helicopters
column5: OTTAWA  Sept 5 Canada could scrap a C$5 billion ($4.8 billion) deal to buy maritime helicopters from United Technologies Corp's Sikorsky unit  the government indicated on Thursday.

column4: Summer deals lift banks' hopes of M&A tipping point
column5: LONDON Verizon's deal to buy Vodafone out of their U.S. wireless venture for $130 billion may have been years in the making  but bankers hope it could be an inflexion point that marks the revival of big dealmaking.

column4: CORRECTED-Summer deals lift banks' hopes of M&A tipping point
column5: (Removes incorrect description of Smith & Nephew as private equity owned)

column4: Wal-Mart and Washington D.C. in minimum wage showdown
column5: WASHINGTON District of Columbia Mayor Vincent Gray could decide as early as this week whether to sign a minimum wage bill that could discourage Wal-Mart Stores Inc   the world's biggest retailer  from opening stores in the U.S. capital.

column4: Wal-Mart  District of Columbia in showdown over minimum wage
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 5 District of Columbia Mayor Vincent Gray could decide as early as this week whether to sign a minimum wage bill that could discourage Wal-Mart Stores Inc   the world's biggest retailer  from opening stores in the U.S. capital.

column4: BRIEF-Munich Re to sell Windsor Health to Wellcare Health
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 5 munich re :  * To sell Windsor health group to wellcare health plans inc.  * Says sale of Windsor health not to have material impact on Munich re's
